docs.text:
• ID: wejsaj-cop-pst
  • Form: wejsaj
  • Parameter_ID: COP-PST
  • Morpho_Segments: wej-saj
  • Language: Yawarana
  • Part_of_speech: intransitive verb
MorphsFormpartsExamples
  • Yawarana wej ‘COP‘
  • Yawarana -saj ‘PST‘
  • wire-1pro-wejsaj-cop-pst-wejsaj-cop-pst-2
  • ana-1-3pro-wejsaj-cop-pst-wejsaj-cop-pst-2
  • montomo-2pl-pro-wejsaj-cop-pst-wejsaj-cop-pst-2
  • tewi-3pro-wejsaj-cop-pst-wejsaj-cop-pst-2
  • ejne-1-2pro-wejsaj-cop-pst-wejsaj-cop-pst-2
  • wej-saj-kontomo-cop-pst-pl-0
  • tewisantomo-3pro-pl-wejsaj-cop-pst-wejsaj-cop-pst-2
  • ta wejsaj wïrë ‘I'm saying...’
  • ana këyetase papa kampra ya, ana yoti wejsapë yojtë ta sukase aroma warai, yakuri warai yojtë wejsaj ta ‘(When) we grew up, my uncle fished our food; fished everything: limpet, picure...’
  • papa kampra ya, makampra ya ta wejsaj ta, maijtë kaimotata, mukuton yomiri ‘My aunt said to my uncle: “go hunt, the children are hungry”.’
  • asamori ta wejsaj ta, irë makë ta wejsapë ‘My aunt said "they are crying".’
  • tejetum pïnika, ta wejsaj ta makë ya, makë pano ya ‘"That one is probably sick", said my mother, my late mother.’
  • sukase ta wejsaj ta, irëjpë papa kampra ijtëri ‘She said that, then my uncle left’
  • irëjpë sakara nepï wejsaj ta, irëjpë michi ‘He brought guabina, then (he said) "here it is".’
  • yakono ijmojkakë mukuton yoti ta wejsaj ta ‘Then she said, "sister cook for the children to eat"’
  • ta ti wejsaj ti tëwï ‘...he said.’

docs.title: Wordform: wejsapë ‘cop-pst’
docs.text:
• ID: wejsape-cop-pst
  • Form: wejsapë
  • Parameter_ID: COP-PST
  • Morpho_Segments: wej-sapë
  • Language: Yawarana
  • Part_of_speech: intransitive verb
MorphsFormpartsExamples
  • Yawarana wej ‘COP‘
  • Yawarana -sapë ‘PST‘
  • ejne-1-2pro-wejsape-cop-pst-wejsape-cop-pst-2
  • tewi-3pro-wejsape-cop-pst-wejsape-cop-pst-2
  • wire-1pro-wejsape-cop-pst-wejsape-cop-pst-2
  • ana-1-3pro-wejsape-cop-pst-wejsape-cop-pst-2
  • tewijpe-3pro-pst-wejsape-cop-pst-wejsape-cop-pst-2
  • tewisantomo-3pro-pl-wejsape-cop-pst-wejsape-cop-pst-2
  • mekisantomo-dist-anim-pl-wejsape-cop-pst-wejsape-cop-pst-2
  • wej-sape-kontomo-cop-pst-pl-0
  • mokonton-2pl-pro-wejsape-cop-pst-wejsape-cop-pst-2
  • mokontomo-2pl-pro-wejsape-cop-pst-wejsape-cop-pst-2
  • keresantomo-prox-anim-pl-wejsape-cop-pst-wejsape-cop-pst-2
  • ati ke ejnë yoti yamanë wejsapë tëwï ‘With that we used to prepare the meat.’
  • tëwï ya nepïjpë wejsapë ‘He brought it.’
  • tawara chipëkë takï wïrë ëmpamïja wejsapë tase wïrë ‘Since it was like that, I did not learn, I said.’
  • kwase neke wejsapë tëwï ma anajmori ya yakarama wejsapë ‘what it was like, that's all your grandmother said.’
  • kwase neke wejsapë tëwï ma anajmori ya yakarama wejsapë ‘what it was like, that's all your grandmother said.’
  • ana këyetase papa kampra ya, ana yoti wejsapë yojtë ta sukase aroma warai, yakuri warai yojtë wejsaj ta ‘(When) we grew up, my uncle fished our food; fished everything: limpet, picure...’
  • asamori ta wejsaj ta, irë makë ta wejsapë ‘My aunt said "they are crying".’
  • irë makë ya ijmojka wejsapë ‘Then my mom was cooking.’
  • irëjpë makë ya ijmojka wejsapë ‘Then my mom was cooking.’
  • tëwï kïmïi yemetïkene, ana yeni wejsapë sukutaka ma ‘After eating chili, we would drink yucuta.’
  • tëwï waraijtokon yakërë, ana këyamase ta wejsapë ‘With that man, he raised us.’
  • takërë ana wejsapë ïmparëjra ‘We were with him for a long time.’
  • ana wejsapë ‘We were.’
  • ana yïwïj yawë ana senejka wejsapë, tawara ma ana këyatajpë ana ‘We stayed at home, that's how we were raised.’
  • irë wejtane mujyampe patakaja wejsapë ‘Despite this, she did not get pregnant.’
  • apatakaja pïnïka wejsapë ‘Maybe she did not come out (pregnant).’
  • tayakïjtëja pïnika wejsapë ‘Maybe he didn't sleep with her.’
  • yajtëpe neke n ti warotakontomo wejsapë ‘At the beginning they worked.’
  • wurijyantomo rë wejsapë ijtë ‘There were only women there.’
  • tawani yawë senejka wejsapë irëjpë ënujse kawë ‘He was staying in the dark and then went up high.’
  • ti waijtaton nwajtë wejsapë ‘The mice were dancing.’
  • wurijyampïjkë kantajnë tawara rë wejsapë ‘The female was singing, too.’
  • pïrarë ti iwenaru wejsapë ‘their vomit was not there.’
  • sujtase ti wejsapë ‘He urinated.’
  • ëjtë kërëjpë yawë nwajtëkonton ti wejsapë waijta ‘In the old house the mice were dancing.’
  • tawara ma ta ti wejsapë tëwï ‘That’s all she said.’
  • ¿mëpana ma tataja wejsapë? ‘Didn't he say it directly to you?’
  • ¿ësëpëkë ka wejsapëkontomo? ‘Were they always argumenting?’
  • irë wa chipëkë tapojtëja wejsapë, irë wa chipëkë tajne wëpëjse tëwï, sukase wïnïjsajkonton yawë ‘That's why I didn't want it, that's why they killed them all when they were asleep.’

  • mërë ya wïrë inija wejtane ‘Although you won't see me.’
  • makë yakërë ma wejtane, tëijpë rë pïjkë ana yïwïtï ‘Even though I was with my mom, our house was a bit far away.’
  • irë wejtane mujyampe patakaja wejsapë ‘Despite this, she did not get pregnant.’
  • yapijtompe wïrë wejtane, ¡kë! wïyapë moroni ‘Although I am old, ugh, my arms hurt.’
  • irë wejtane ti ‘Although this was the case,’
  • marë wïrë sëmpinukuja rë wejtane mokontomo unono, wïrë nono yenekapëkë pako ‘Though I haven't closed my eyes yet, you are already taking my land from me.’

  • wïrë yaruwarijra ‘I don’t laugh.’
  • wïrë yaruwakempïnirë, mëkïsantomo a-ja-ja tajtane ‘I don’t laugh although they are saying “hahaha”.’
  • ¡kï! ¿mokontomo serekapojra ka mokontomo yaruwari? wïrë yaruwarijra taro wïrë, ta ta wïrë ya ‘Oh! You don’t get tired of laughing? I don’t laugh, is what I’m saying.’

docs.title: Wordform: yakërë ‘lk-with’
docs.text:
• ID: yakere-lk-with
  • Form: yakërë
  • Parameter_ID: LK-with
  • Morpho_Segments: y-akërë
  • Language: Yawarana
  • Part_of_speech: postposition
MorphsFormpartsExamples
  • Yawarana y- ‘LK‘
  • Yawarana akërë ‘with‘
  • me-y-akere-2-lk-with-1
  • u-y-akere-1-lk-with-1
  • wire-1pro-yakere-lk-with-yakere-lk-with-2
  • ejne-1-2pro-yakere-lk-with-yakere-lk-with-2
  • mokontom-2pl-pro-yakere-lk-with-yakere-lk-with-2
  • tewi-3pro-yakere-lk-with-yakere-lk-with-2
  • ana-1-3pro-yakere-lk-with-yakere-lk-with-2
  • tewisantomo-3pro-pl-yakere-lk-with-yakere-lk-with-2
  • mekisantomo-dist-anim-pl-yakere-lk-with-yakere-lk-with-2
  • y-akere-ne-lk-with-ints-0
  • aniki narëpe yakërë ejnë përemekïrï, ejnë pëkëpene, wanene ‘Who are we gonna talk to? We’re alone, aunt.’
  • wïrë tëtojpe mëyakërë ‘None’
  • mërë warë mëyënëtojpano ka uyakërë mërë wepïrï ‘So for you to eat you came with me?’
  • ipakuri yakërë ‘with his arrow.’
  • sukase ana këyetase pipi yakërë, ana këyetase intipijkë ana chawë ‘We grew up with my younger brother; we grew up when we were small.’
  • Rafa Perez pan yakërë ‘With the late Rafel Perez.’
  • irëjpë, tëwï yakërë, ana këyatase ‘Then we grew up with him.’
  • ana këyatase tëwï yakërë ‘We grew up with him.’
  • ana padrastro yakërë ‘With our stepfather.’
  • tëwï waraijtokon yakërë, ana këyamase ta wejsapë ‘With that man, he raised us.’
  • makë yakërë ma wejtane, tëijpë rë pïjkë ana yïwïtï ‘Even though I was with my mom, our house was a bit far away.’

  • yaruwakempïnirë wïrë ‘I don’t laugh.’
  • wïrë yaruwakempïnirë wïrë senejkarï uyïwïj yaka sukuri, jwama ‘I don’t laugh, I silently stay in my house.’
  • tawaraij wïrë, yaruwakempïnirë, ‘I’m not like that, I don’t laugh.’

docs.title: Wordform: yaruwari ‘laugh-ipfv’
docs.text:
• ID: yaruwari-laugh-ipfv

MorphsFormpartsExamples

  • yaruwa-ri-jra-laugh-ipfv-neg-0
  • ejne-1-2pro-yaruwari-laugh-ipfv-yaruwari-laugh-ipfv-2
  • mokontomo-2pl-pro-yaruwari-laugh-ipfv-yaruwari-laugh-ipfv-2
  • mekisantomo-dist-anim-pl-yaruwari-laugh-ipfv-yaruwari-laugh-ipfv-2
  • mëyaruwari, mëpëkëpene ‘You just laugh.’
  • wïrë yaruwarijra ‘I don’t laugh.’
  • ejnë yaruwari tajne yakarama pëkë rë nwarë, nope esene mare, tawara neke ne, ënka ‘We laugh when somebody tells (us) something, something you see well, like that, right.’
  • ¿kwase ejnë yaruwari? ‘How will we laugh?’
  • ¡kï! ¿mokontomo serekapojra ka mokontomo yaruwari? wïrë yaruwarijra taro wïrë, ta ta wïrë ya ‘Oh! You don’t get tired of laughing? I don’t laugh, is what I’m saying.’
  • ¡kï! ¿mokontomo serekapojra ka mokontomo yaruwari? wïrë yaruwarijra taro wïrë, ta ta wïrë ya ‘Oh! You don’t get tired of laughing? I don’t laugh, is what I’m saying.’
  • ¿ati ejnë yaruwari? ‘What are we going to laugh about?’
  • ¿ati pëkë ejnë yaruwari? ‘What are we going to laugh about?’
  • mëkïsantomo yaruwari wïrë itari ‘They’re laughing and I’m listening.’
  • kï, serekapojra ka mokontomo yaruwari ‘Ugh, don’t you get tired from laughing so much?’

docs.title: Wordform: yawë ‘loc’
docs.text:
• ID: yawe-loc
  • Form: yawë
  • Parameter_ID: LOC
  • Morpho_Segments: yawë
  • Language: Yawarana
  • Part_of_speech: postposition
MorphsFormpartsExamples
  • Yawarana yawë ‘LOC‘
  • tewi-3pro-yawe-loc-yawe-loc-2
  • wire-1pro-yawe-loc-yawe-loc-2
  • ejne-1-2pro-yawe-loc-yawe-loc-2
  • ana-1-3pro-yawe-loc-yawe-loc-2
  • mokontomo-2pl-pro-yawe-loc-yawe-loc-2
  • tewisantomo-3pro-pl-yawe-loc-yawe-loc-2
  • mokonton-2pl-pro-yawe-loc-yawe-loc-2
  • tewijpe-3pro-pst-yawe-loc-yawe-loc-2
  • yawe-jne-loc-pl-0
  • uyïwïj yawë usenejkari sukuri jwama ‘I silently stay in my house.’
  • ejnë pëkëpene ejnë chi yawë, ejnë yarikaja ‘When we’re alone, we don’t laugh.’
  • ana këyetajpë, intipijkë ana chi yawë ‘We grew up when we were little kids’
  • papa pano sëmasaj yawë ‘Because my dad had died.’
  • ana yïwïj yawë ana senejka wejsapë, tawara ma ana këyatajpë ana ‘We stayed at home, that's how we were raised.’
  • tawani yawë senejka wejsapë irëjpë ënujse kawë ‘He was staying in the dark and then went up high.’
  • irëjpë tawejka yawë ‘Then, in the morning...’
  • ëjtë kërëjpë yawë nwajtëkonton ti wejsapë waijta ‘In the old house the mice were dancing.’
  • irë wa chipëkë tapojtëja wejsapë, irë wa chipëkë tajne wëpëjse tëwï, sukase wïnïjsajkonton yawë ‘That's why I didn't want it, that's why they killed them all when they were asleep.’

docs.title: Wordform: yoti ‘lk-meat-pert’
docs.text:
• ID: yoti-lk-meat-pert
  • Form: yoti
  • Parameter_ID: LK-meat-PERT
  • Morpho_Segments: y-oti-∅
  • Language: Yawarana
  • Part_of_speech: noun
MorphsFormpartsExamples
  • Yawarana y- ‘LK‘
  • Yawarana oti ‘meat‘
  • Yawarana -∅ ‘PERT‘
  • tewi-3pro-yoti-lk-meat-pert-yoti-lk-meat-pert-2
  • ejne-1-2pro-yoti-lk-meat-pert-yoti-lk-meat-pert-2
  • mokontomo-2pl-pro-yoti-lk-meat-pert-yoti-lk-meat-pert-2
  • ana-1-3pro-yoti-lk-meat-pert-yoti-lk-meat-pert-2
  • me-y-oti-2-lk-meat-pert-1
  • wire-1pro-yoti-lk-meat-pert-yoti-lk-meat-pert-2
  • toto yoti tajtoj mare ‘What they call the food of the criollos.’
  • ati ke ejnë yoti yamanë wejsapë tëwï ‘With that we used to prepare the meat.’
  • ana këyetase papa kampra ya, ana yoti wejsapë yojtë ta sukase aroma warai, yakuri warai yojtë wejsaj ta ‘(When) we grew up, my uncle fished our food; fished everything: limpet, picure...’
  • yakono ijmojkakë mukuton yoti ta wejsaj ta ‘Then she said, "sister cook for the children to eat"’
  • ana yoti, ana serematojpe ‘Our food, to eat.’
  • taturu makampra ya ana yoti makë ‘My aunt gave her our food.’
  • ana yoti, yakuri ‘Our food, agouti.’

docs.title: Topics
docs.text: • Possession

docs.title: Topic: Possession
docs.text:
Possession is an asymmetric relationship between two constituents, the referent of one of which (the possessor) in some sense possesses (owns, has as a part, rules over, etc.) the referent of the other (the possessed).

  • Suffixes for possessed and non-possessed nouns
  • Inflectional prefixes
  • Root suppletion in nominal possession
  • The noun phrase
